data.title: Works by Edward Bulwer, First Edition
data.meta_description: The Dramatic Works of Sir Edward Bulwer Lytton Bart vol 1 by Sir Edward Bulwer Lytton Bart and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Fair. No Jacket. 1st Edition. Green cloth bound decorated covers, with green boards and gold lettering on the spine. Previous owners signature and bookplate on the inset page, tanning and wear to the spine and some spotting on the pages.Vol one Contains three plays, as well as illustrations. Message for images.

Hardcover. 17,7 x 10,7 cm. Brown half-leather volume, rubbed; the gilt embossed title on spine is faded. A name written in old ink on the fly-leaf. VIII, 551 pages. Inside with only some brownish spots but mostly clean. Binding in good condition. According to the age good condition. / 17,7 x 10,7 cm. Brauner Halblederband, berieben. Der goldgeprägte Rückentitel verblasst. Ein Name in alter Tinte auf dem Titelblatt. VIII, 551 Seiten. Innen schwankend leicht braunfleckig, überwiegend jedoch sauber, die Bindung fest. Altersgemäß gut erhalten. -- Bitte Portokosten außerhalb EU erfragen! / Please ask for postage costs outside EU! / S ' il vous plait demander des frais de port en dehors de l ' UE! -- Genießen Sie den Sommer und bestellen Sie was zum Lesen! LitFre.

Hardcover. 17,7 x 10,7 cm. Brown half-leather volume, rubbed; the corners slightly bumped. The gilt embossed title on spine is faded. VIII, 620 pages. Inside with only some brownish spots, the first and last pages a little bit more. Pages 59 / 60 with brownish spots. Binding in good condition. According to the age good condition at all. / 17,7 x 10,7 cm. Brauner Halblederband, berieben. Der goldgeprägte Rückentitel verblasst. Die Ecken leicht bestoßen. VIII, 620 Seiten. Innen schwankend leicht braunfleckig, die ersten und letzten Seiten etwas stärker betroffen. Die Seiten 59/60 leicht fleckig. Überwiegend jedoch sauber, die Bindung fest. Altersgemäß gut erhalten. -- Bitte Portokosten außerhalb EU erfragen! / Please ask for postage costs outside EU! / S ' il vous plait demander des frais de port en dehors de l ' UE! -- Genießen Sie den Sommer und bestellen Sie was zum Lesen! LitFre.

1st edition. Complete in 3 volumes; bound in dark burgundy cloth, with gilt lettering on spine. Ex Bray Parochial Lending Library, with bookplate on front free end paper, & handwritten name & later owner's stamp on title page in all volumes. A little light scattered foxing; some wear to board corners, & at head & foot of spine, & along spine joints. This is a heavy set (about 3kg packed); additional postage may be required Used - Good. Ex lib hardbacks in dark burgundy cloth.

First Edition. Very good copy in the original gilt-blocked cloth. Slight suggestion only of dust-dulling to the spine bands and panel edges. Remains particularly well-preserved overall; tight, bright, clean and strong.; 8vo 8" - 9" tall; 0 pages; Description: 6v., fronts., plates ; 21cm. 6 volumes of Lytton's historical fiction. Contents: The last days of Pompeii -- Rienz, the last of the Roman tribunes -- The last of the barons [vols. 1 & 2] -- Harold, the last of the Saxon Kings [vols. 1 & 2]. Genre: Historical fiction -- Novel -- History -- Historical romance. 6 Kg.

First Edition. Very good copy in the original gilt-blocked cloth. Slight suggestion only of dust-dulling to the spine bands and panel edges. Remains particularly well-preserved overall; tight, bright, clean and strong.; 8vo 8" - 9" tall; 0 pages; Description: 6v., fronts., plates ; 21cm. 6 volumes of Lytton's historical fiction. Contents: The last days of Pompeii -- Rienz, the last of the Roman tribunes -- The last of the barons [vols. 1 & 2] -- Harold, the last of the Saxon Kings [vols. 1 & 2]. Genre: Historical fiction -- Novel -- History -- Historical romance. 6 Kg.

Leather Binding. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. First Edition. Small 8vos. ca. 700 pages / volume. Title on spines: Bulwer's Novels. Incomplete set of the novels, in later reprint editions; contains 'The Last Days of Pompeii', 'Night and Morning', 'Lucretia: Or, The Children of Night', 'The Caxtons: A Family Picture', 'Rienzi, The Last of the Roman Tribunes', and 'Paul Clifford'. Date is conjectural (none of the volumes is dated). Notable for the frontispiece illustrations by H.K. Browne and John Gilbert (lacking only the frontispiece to 'Last Days'). 3 volumes total; bound in 3/4 tan polished calf over maroon cockerell boards, gilt-stamped and decorated spines with raised bands, gilt-stamped black and dark brown morocco spine labels, matching maroon edges and endpapers. Slight wear and rubbing to extremities; slight rubbing to covers; previous owner's engraved armorial bookplate on front attached endpaper of all volumes; slight internal browning and/or foxing throughout.Few Engraved Illustrations (advertising matter).

Leather Binding. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. First Edition. 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" 25 volume set, attractively bound in 3/4 green morocco over marbled boards, spines with raised bands and gilt floral tooling within gilt-bordered compartments, top edges gilt, marbled endpapers (spines faded to brown with some nicking to spine tips). Copy #23 of 100 numbered copies of the Edition De Luxe. 25 volumes, complete as issued. Includes: Paul Clifford; Lucretia, or, The children of night; Ernest Maltravers; Pelham, or, Adventures of a gentleman; Eugene Aram; Alice, or, The mysteries; The last days of Pompeii; Godolphin; Leila, or, The siege of Granada; A strange story; The pilgrims of the Rhine; My novel; The disowned; The Caxtons; a family picture; Devereux; Zanoni; Kenelm Chillingly; his adventures and opinions; Harold; the last of the Saxon kings; The last of the barons; What will he do with it?; Rienzi; the last of the Roman tribunes; Night and morning; The Parisians.B/w Illustrations.

First Edition. Very good set in the original gilt-blocked cloth, with gilt-blocked title and blind tooling to spine. Slight suggestion of dust-dulling and rubbing to the spine bands and panel edges; some copies lightly foxed. Remains particularly well-preserved overall; tight, bright, and clean. Physical desription; 24 vol.: illustrations ; 23 cm. Notes; Date is suggested. Rubricked title. Contents; Rienzi, the last of the Roman tribunes I&II -- The last days of Pompei I&II -- Ernest Maltravers I&II -- Paul Clifford I&II -- Alice, or, the mysteries I&II -- Leila, or, the siege of Granada: including Calderon the courtier and Pausanias the Spartan I&II -- Devereux I&II -- Pelham, or, the adventures of a gentleman I&II -- Eugene Aram, a tale I&II -- Harold, the last of the Saxon kings I&II -- The last of the barons I-IV. Subjects; Lytton, Edward Bulwer. Great Britain Authors 19th century. English literature 19th century. Fiction, England. 1 Kg.
